title: (x) British GQ Magazine - Lexia, ITC Fenice (custom versions) {Fabio, Paul Ross}
content:
Hello Typoguru's...   
A client has asked me to ID two fonts from GQ magazine (UK). I picked them as Glypha light and Fenice ultra - but they're both not quite right. Can anyone here with better eyes and more knowledge of the UK mag scene pick these two...?   
   
 ![Glypha-GQmag1](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16866.gif)   
 ![Fenice-GQmag2](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16867.gif)
author: skyrocket

comments.content: the bottom one appears to be Fat Face.

it's not Fat Face, but it maybe a custom take on Fat Face?   
   
 [www.identifont.com/show?61K](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334/http:/www.identifont.com/show?61K)

I think this slab-serif is the Pan, designed by Dalton Maag, see here:   
   
 [http://www.daltonmaag.com/docs/Lexia.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/docs/Lexia.pdf)
Thanks Fabio but that link points to a PDF on the font Lexia.

i see that Yves is smart.   
   
Paul,don't "waste" your time ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) if you want to know the typeface- find the art director..... his paper will pay good money for type.   
   
   
   
   
David Hamuel

Thanks all. I'm not wasting my time as a big magazine here in Australia wants to know the answer to this question. I hope I'm not wasting YOUR time then? I reckon you lot do these for fun and it's a great service for folks like me. Lexia looks correct doesn't it? Like I said before - this forum is the dogs bollux. TTFN...

The slab serif looks indeed like a lighter version   
of Dalton Maag's [Lexia](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/fonts/exclusives/lexia.html), and the modern face is   
a display version of [ITC Fenice Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-fenice/ultra/testdrive.html?s=icon%20adam%20faith&p=48) by Aldo   
Novarese (well spotted Paul!).   
   
GQ Magazine being one of the big ones, it is not   
unthinkable that they use customized versions of   
these typefaces.

_\> I hope I'm not wasting YOUR time then? I reckon you   
lot do these for fun and it's a great service for folks   
like me._      
Here's [my response](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/13632.html#POST24415) to that question. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154334im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
Don't worry, when I'm _really_ busy, my reaction time   
drops spectacularly, and I won't hesitate to tell you so.
